instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: This week will recive Macbook 15 from 2010. It is dual core. Customer told me that there is gpu problems. This model comes with mcp only or has nvidia gpu?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: I know this cap, but this is not icore. It is dual core.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: Then it is not a 2010. Need board number or serial number.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: These never have GPU issues only MUX issue. What is the actual problem?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message:
White screen. Apple appear and then white screen. Mouse never appears
No external screen.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message:
Very strange. I checked serial number and it is [URL="http://www.everymac.com/systems/apple/macbook_pro/specs/macbook-pro-core-2-duo-2.66-aluminum-15-mid-2009-sd-unibody-specs.html"]MacBook Pro "Core 2 Duo" 2.66 15" (SD)[/URL] 2009
but I just took the laptop (I have it now in the workshop) and it has 820-2915 board with 0005 GPU. So, somebody replaced botom case or board.
RAM is 10600. Problem is white screen and mouse never appear. Also somebody replaced them GPU it has data code 1516.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: Clean it up and send to Apple...Original serial number should be on the memory slot for you to use to bring it to Apple.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: Do you think they will replace the board if GPU is already replaced by someone else?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: As long as it is not all fucked up and serial number is still on the memory slot. Inspect board and clean flux and crap off the GPU of course.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Macbook 15  from 2010
threads.message: Apple ask for invoice here and I dont have. I replaced GPU and it works now.
